ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: basic skills for learning to speak, understand, read, and write in Yoruba
While taking this course, I developed the ability to speak and listen to others in a language that was new to me, and comprehend a majority of what was being said.
I feel as though my knowledge about Yoruba culture and the language has increased a lot, as well as my skills in reading, writing, and speaking the language
I learned the basics of the Yoruba language.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Great course we have many realistic opportunities to speak and practice the language
Strengths: everything. The professor is really accommodating and great at engaging students in the course

A solid strength of the course was the engagement of the students during class and proving us with opportunities to improve our understanding of the material with in class practice. A small weakness was the amount of work would feel a bit overwhelming but I understand that it was necessary to learn a new language

Strengths: The Professor is fantastic! He is clearly very knowledgeable about linguistics and the Yoruba language, and makes the class very accessible to all. He is prepared to adjust the class to student needs. 

No real weaknesses! Just be prepared to work at this daily through homework assignments like any other class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, it is a good African language and the class is engaging
Yes, really great course. The instructor is great, and it really is a fun language to learn
Absolutely! The class is really fun and interesting. I have learned a lot of Yoruba language and culture
yes, I would recommend this course to another student because of how amazing the professor is

Yes I would because the professor made the class very interesting and is very easy to approach if you faced any challenges with the material. Plus learning the Yoruba language and its culture was quite interesting
Take it!!!! The professor is so nice and understanding, the language isnt too hard to pick up and youll have a great time.

I would absolutely recommend! Especially if you have people in your life who can speak Yoruba. It was great to be able to speak to my family, I was shocked by just how much I learned over one semester. I can now speak in light conversation. The class is best when everyone is invested in the learning process, so if you do choose to take the class be sure to come with this positive attitude and energy!
